snippet: Bishop V. Gene Robinson, who last year retired from his post heading New Hampshire’s diocese, said he would end his relationship, which began as a civil union in 2008 and was later recognized as a marriage.
abstract: Bishop V Gene Robinson, who made history as first openly gay bishop in the Episcopal Church, announces that he and his husband are planning to divorce.
lead_paragraph: Bishop V. Gene Robinson, who last year retired from his post heading New Hampshire’s diocese, said he would end his relationship, which began as a civil union in 2008 and was later recognized as a marriage.

headline.main: First Openly Gay Episcopal Bishop, Whose Election Caused a Stir, to Divorce
headline.print_headline: First Openly Gay Episcopal Bishop, Whose Election Caused a Stir, to Divorce

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
